meanings.definition: The electrode by which electrons enter a device.
meanings.sent1: The kathode in the battery attracts electrons.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to connect the kathode properly to allow electron flow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous electron tried to sneak into the device through the kathode.
meanings.sent4: The kathode acted like a welcoming gate for the electrons entering the circuit.
meanings.sent5: Visualize the kathode as the gateway for electrons to power up the device.

meanings.sent1: The kathode repels negative charges due to its own negative charge.
meanings.sent2: The scientist carefully labeled the kathode as negative in the circuit diagram.
meanings.sent3: The kathode felt lonely being negative among all the positive electrodes.
meanings.sent4: In the world of electrodes, the kathode stood out as the bearer of negativity.
meanings.sent5: The kathode's negative charge was like a magnet pushing away other charges.
